intro: Justicia rottleriana, commonly known as the flame violet, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its striking, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange. The plant typically grows as a shrub or perennial herb, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly rough texture. The flowers are arranged in spikes and bloom during the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
